ca.uhn.fhir.rest.server.interceptor

Class AuditingInterceptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uhn.fhir.rest.server.interceptor.InterceptorAdapter
      • ca.uhn.fhir.rest.server.interceptor.AuditingInterceptor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IServerInterceptor

    public class AuditingInterceptor
extends InterceptorAdapter
    Server interceptor that provides auditing capability To use, set a data store that implements the IAuditDataStore interface, specify

    • Field Detail

      • mySiteId

        protected String mySiteId

    • Constructor Detail

      • AuditingInterceptor

        public AuditingInterceptor()
        Create a new AuditingInterceptor with auditing required by default and a siteid of "NONE"

      • AuditingInterceptor

        public AuditingInterceptor(String theSiteId)
        Create a new AuditingInterceptor with auditing required by default and a site ID as specified
        Parameters:
        theSiteId - the name of the site producing the audit data (will be set as SecurityEvent.Source.siteid)

      • AuditingInterceptor

        public AuditingInterceptor(String theSiteId,
                           boolean theClientParamsOptional)
        Create a new AuditingInterceptor with the specified site ID and indicating if auditing is optional or required
        Parameters:
        theSiteId - theSiteId the name of the site producing the audit data (will be set as SecurityEvent.Source.siteid)
        theClientParamsOptional - - true if auditing is optional, false if auditing is required (will throw exception if user params are not specified or audit store is not set)

      • store

        protected void store(SecurityEvent auditEvent)
              throws Exception
        Store the SecurityEvent generated for this request to a persistent store (database, file, JMS, etc)
        Parameters:
        auditEvent - the SecurityEvent generated for this request
        Throws:
        Exception - if the data store is not configured or if an error occurs during storage

      • getEventInfo

        protected SecurityEvent.Event getEventInfo(RequestDetails theRequestDetails)
        Generates the Event segment of the SecurityEvent based on the incoming request details
        Parameters:
        theRequestDetails - the RequestDetails of the incoming request
        Returns:
        an Event populated with the action, date, and outcome

      • getQueryFromRequestDetails

        protected byte[] getQueryFromRequestDetails(RequestDetails theRequestDetails)
        Return the query URL encoded to bytes to be set as the Object.query on the Security Event
        Parameters:
        theRequestDetails - the RequestDetails of the incoming request
        Returns:
        the query URL of the request encoded to bytes

      • getObjectElement

        protected SecurityEvent.ObjectElement getObjectElement(IResource resource,
                                                       SecurityEventObjectLifecycleEnum lifecycle,
                                                       byte[] query)
                                                throws InstantiationException,
                                                       IllegalAccessException
        If the resource is considered an auditable resource containing PHI, create an ObjectElement, otherwise return null
        Parameters:
        resource - the resource to be audited
        lifecycle - the SecurityEventObjectLifecycleEnum of the request
        query - the byte encoded query string of the request
        Returns:
        an ObjectElement populated with information about the resource
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException - if the auditor for this resource cannot be instantiated
        InstantiationException - if the auditor for this resource cannot be instantiated

      • makeObjectDetail

        protected SecurityEvent.ObjectDetail makeObjectDetail(String type,
                                                      String value)
        Helper method to create an ObjectDetail from a pair of Strings.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the ObjectDetail
        value - the value of the ObejctDetail to be encoded
        Returns:
        an ObjectDetail of the given type and value

      • getParticipant

        protected SecurityEvent.Participant getParticipant(HttpServletRequest theServletRequest)
                                            throws InvalidRequestException,
                                                   org.apache.commons.lang3.NotImplementedException
        Create a participant object based on information from the incoming servlet request
        Parameters:
        theServletRequest - the incoming request
        Returns:
        a Participant object populated with the user id, user name, and IP
        Throws:
        InvalidRequestException - if auditing is required but userId is not specified as a request header
        org.apache.commons.lang3.NotImplementedException - if the authorization type is OAuth

      • getSourceElement

        protected SecurityEvent.Source getSourceElement(HttpServletRequest theServletRequest)
                                         throws org.apache.commons.lang3.NotImplementedException
        Create a Source object based on information in the incoming request
        Parameters:
        theServletRequest - the incoming request
        Returns:
        a Source object with the identifier, type, and site specified
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.lang3.NotImplementedException - if the authorization type is OAuth

      • getSiteId

        protected StringDt getSiteId(HttpServletRequest theServletRequest)
        Returns the site ID (for SecurityEvent.source.siteid)
        Parameters:
        theServletRequest - the incoming request
        Returns:
        the site ID to audit. By default, uses the value set in the constructor. Override this method to set the value via request parameters.

      • getAccessType

        protected List<CodingDt> getAccessType(HttpServletRequest theServletRequest)
        Return the access type for this request
        Parameters:
        theServletRequest - the incoming request
        Returns:
        the SecurityEventSourceTypeEnum representing the type of request being made

      • mapResourceTypeToSecurityEventAction

        protected SecurityEventActionEnum mapResourceTypeToSecurityEventAction(RestOperationTypeEnum theRestfulOperationTypeEnum)
        Returns the SecurityEventActionEnum corresponding to the specified RestfulOperationTypeEnum
        Parameters:
        theRestfulOperationTypeEnum - the type of operation (Read, Create, Delete, etc)
        Returns:
        the corresponding SecurityEventActionEnum (Read/View/Print, Create, Delete, etc)

      • mapResourceTypeToSecurityLifecycle

        protected SecurityEventObjectLifecycleEnum mapResourceTypeToSecurityLifecycle(RestOperationTypeEnum theRestfulOperationTypeEnum)
        Returns the SecurityEventObjectLifecycleEnum corresponding to the specified RestfulOperationTypeEnum
        Parameters:
        theRestfulOperationTypeEnum - the type of operation (Read, Create, Delete, etc)
        Returns:
        the corresponding SecurityEventObjectLifecycleEnum (Access/Use, Origination/Creation, Logical Deletion, etc)

      • setDataStore

        public void setDataStore(IAuditDataStore theDataStore)
        Provide a persistent store implementing IAuditDataStore to store the audit events
        Parameters:
        theDataStore - an implementation of IAuditDataStore to be used to store the audit events

      • getAuditableResources

        public Map<String,Class<? extends IResourceAuditor<? extends IResource>>> getAuditableResources()
        Get this auditor's map of auditable resources and auditors
        Returns:
        the map of auditable resource types to auditors

      • setAuditableResources

        public void setAuditableResources(Map<String,Class<? extends IResourceAuditor<? extends IResource>>> theAuditableResources)
        Specify which types of resources are to be audited (Patient, Encounter, etc) and provide an IResourceAuditor for each type
        Parameters:
        theAuditableResources - a map of resources to be audited and their corresponding IResouceAuditors

      • addAuditableResource

        public void addAuditableResource(String resourceType,
                                 Class<? extends IResourceAuditor<? extends IResource>> auditableResource)
        Add a type of auditable resource and its auditor to this AuditingInterceptor's resource map
        Parameters:
        resourceType - the type of resource to be audited (Patient, Encounter, etc)
        auditableResource - an implementation of IResourceAuditor that can audit resources of the given type
